## PC cmds

| Command                       | Comments on command                         |
| ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| `Ctrl-Shift-6`                | Abort DNS lookup, tracert, ping command     |
| `C:\>ipconfig /all`           | Show PC settings from the PC Command Prompt |
| `route print` or `netstat -r` | Show routing table and gateway in a PC      |

## Basic settings

| Command                                           | Comments on command                         |
| ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| `(config)# hostname <name>`                       | Set the router hostname                     |
| `(config)# banner motd #< Some random message >#` | Configure message of the day banner         |
| `R1(config)#no ip domain-lookup`                  | Prevent unwanted DNS lookups                |
| `R1(config)#no logging console`                   | Prevent unwanted status messages on console |
| `(config)# enable secret <password>`              | Set privileged exec password                |

## Line configuration

### Enter line

We have 3 lines:

- Console line
- VTY line
- AUX line (router only)

Enter line:

| Command                         | Comments on command                     |
| ------------------------------- | --------------------------------------- |
| `(config)# line vty <X> <XX>`   | Enter VTY line configuration <br> Check number of vty lines using `sh run`            |
| `(config)# line <con or aux> 0` | Enter console or AUX line configuration |

{{<pagebreak>}}

Common config for each line:

| Command                                   | Comments on command                                                           |
| ----------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `(config-line)# password <some password>` | Set password for the line                                                     |
| `(config-line)# login`                    | Activate the password on the line; line wonâ€™t accept connections without this |

VTY line config:

| Command                                   | Comments on command                                                           |
| ----------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `(config-line)# transport input <protocol>`                       | Set protocols allowed on a line (e.g., SSH)                                  |

## Interface configuration

| Command                                              | Comments on command                  |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------ |
| `(config)# int <vlan <XXXX> OR gX/X/X> OR loopback0` | Enter an interface for configuration |

Note: the interface won't be enabled until `no shut` is executed. You don't have to execute this for a switch, but there are some interfaces in a switch that require it, iirc. Just execute `no shut` wherever you configure an interface. You won't receive an error anyway

### IPv4

| Command                                               | Comments on command              |
| ----------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
| `(config-if)# ip add <an ipv4 address> <subnet mask>` | Assign IPv4 address to interface |
| `(config-if)# description <this is optional>`         | Optional interface description   |
| `(config-if)# no shut`                                | Enable the interface             |

{{<pagebreak>}}

### IPv6

Outside interface:

| Command                                                                   | Comments on command                       |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------- |
| `(config)# ipv6 unicast-routing`                                          | Enable IPv6 routing on the device         |

In interface:

| Command                                                                   | Comments on command                                                                               |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `(config-if)# ipv6 enable`                                                | Enable IPv6 on the interface                                                                      |
| `(config-if)# ipv6 add <an ipv6 address>/<subnet mask in slash notation>` | Assign IPv6 unicast address with prefix                                                           |
| `(config-if)# ipv6 address FE80::1 link-local`                             | Assign link-local IPv6 address <br> `link-local` can be shortened to `link` but I don't recommend |
| `(config-if)# description <this is optional>`                             | Optional interface description                                                                    |
| `(config-if)# no shut`                                                    | Enable the interface                                                                              |

## Save config

| Command            | Comments on command                                 |
| ------------------ | --------------------------------------------------- |
| `# copy run start` | Save running configuration to startup configuration |

## Reset config

| Command                  | Comments on command                     |
| ------------------------ | --------------------------------------- |
| `# Erase startup-config` | Reset configuration                     |
| `# Del vlan.dat`         | Remove VLAN configuration (switch only) |
| `# Reload`               | Reload the device                       |
